column4: Ok, I have ubuntu on slave drive with communication online, then installed suse 10.0, it wouldn't communicate, ubuntu live will not work online, a second ubuntu install will not work, why only one install will communicate online
And I have caBLE MODEM
how is your modem attached to the computer?
USB
it's fairly typical that some distributions will autodetect a piece of hardware while others won't.
if it doesn't work in Ubuntu, you'll have to find the drivers and configure them and pppoe yourself.
both ubuntu installs are off the same CD
oh, and one works, the other doesn't?
that is correct
and both were set at always online
can you find out in the install that works, what modules it loads for the modem. Then you can check for errors relating to loading that module in the other installation.
I am questioning linux on HP, but i will need to find the driver files
really your best option would be to fix your ethernet.
if that will even work, why only the first install works getsme, I appreciate your help!
it's hard to tell unless you can pinpoint the specific point of failure and report an error message.
I'll let you know what i figure out
I'll have to leave now, but there are always helpful people around as you know.
thanks
does it list boot choices when you hit Tab at the yaboot prompt?
yes
i've tried live, live video=ofonly, and live-nosplash-powerpc
perhaps try "live vga=771" (generic video mode, not sure if it'll work on ppc)
